meanings.definition: To equip or secure with a ferrule.
meanings.sent1: She ferruled the umbrella to make it sturdier.
meanings.sent2: He always ferruled the ends of his walking sticks for added strength.
meanings.sent3: The crafty squirrel ferruled its nest with twigs and leaves for extra protection.
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith ferruled the sword with a golden band, making it look majestic.
meanings.sent5: The gardener ferruled the plant stems with metal caps to prevent them from bending.

meanings.definition: To attach a ferrule to something.
meanings.sent1: The handyman ferruled the loose chair leg to keep it from wobbling.
meanings.sent2: She carefully ferruled the pencil to protect the eraser.
meanings.sent3: The chef ferruled the handle of the knife with a colorful band for a touch of style.
meanings.sent4: The artist ferruled the paintbrush with a silver ring, giving it a unique look.
meanings.sent5: He ferruled the flagpole with a metal cap to prevent the flag from tearing in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The ferruled cane was both elegant and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: She admired the ferruled edges of the antique mirror.
meanings.sent3: The ferruled umbrella handle gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The ferruled sword hilt had intricate designs etched into it.
meanings.sent5: The ferruled curtain rod added a touch of sophistication to the room.
